segments.text: I can't believe how calm the woman looks while drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems completely unaware of the water spilling all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy struggling to reach the cookie jar, standing on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, not a care in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit annoyed that the woman isn't paying attention to any of this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge of the sink, and she doesn't even glance at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the dishes stacked neatly by the sink, completely untouched by the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, it's almost ironic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should really turn off that faucet before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a bit sad to see such a mess happening in an otherwise lovely kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman turns around soon and sees what's going on.
segments.speaker: PAR
